amendment.description: Amendment sought to require the Secretary of Education to conduct an assessment of the impact of school start times on student health, well-being, and performance.
amendment.purpose: An amendment No. 32 printed in part B of House Report 114-29 to require the Secretary of Education to conduct an assessment of the impact of school start times on student health, well-being, and performance.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A032) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 228 (Roll no. 412).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Grayson amendment (A032) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 228 (Roll no. 412).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A032) offered by Mr. Grayson.
